subject: Psychology
title: Reactance Theory
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Reactance Theory.

hook.text: Tell a teenager not to date someone and they want that person more. Banning something makes it desirable.

buildup.text: Reactance is the motivational state triggered when you feel your freedom is being restricted or eliminated.

discovery.text: Jack Brehm showed that when a choice is removed, people want it more intensely than before it was taken away.

twist.text: Heavy-handed persuasion often backfires through reactance. The harder you push, the harder people push back.

climax.text: Effective persuasion preserves the feeling of choice. Let people feel they decided freely, even if you guided them.

punchline.text: Push too hard and people will resist just to feel free.

quiz.question: What triggers psychological reactance?
options: Feeling that your freedom is being restricted
